title: Usasauki2004
author: Usasauki2004
content: Hello everyone, I am newbie and it of great pleasure to be part of this forum. I have had alot about bitcoin for long but not known to me that there's a forum created like this for issues concerning bitcoin to be discussed. I am overwhelmed by this and accolades given to the person that introduced me. The aim is to be of assistance and show me way forward in order for me to know more about bitcoin. Will really be joyous if the assistant is being rendered.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.created_time: October 03, 2023, 01:04:35 PMLast edit: October 03, 2023, 01:18:00 PM by Cantsay
comments.body: Welcome to Bitcointalk.orgI believe the first thing any newbies should do once they have signed up an account here is to go through the rule[1] of the forum so as to avoid any issues that might arise when one is unaware of the rules.And since you stated that you  needed some guidance I'll leave you with some links to resources that will help you get started, so do well to go through them i.e if you're really serious about learning bitcoin or crypto as a whole. https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters https://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/ https://learnmeabitcoin.com/Beginners & Encyclopaedia Trust me, if you really take your time and go through the forum and read previous threads that have been created you'll see that there are tons of information hidden in here and all you have to do is "search[2][3]". And once again welcome to bitcointalk I hope you have a smooth learning journey.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0[2] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341[3] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5464746.0

comments.body: Welcome to the forum. Patiently go through the links provided for you by at @Cantsay and the helpful topics supplied by Bitcoin_Arena and you are good to go. Also to thrive on this forum, you'd need to understand that this is a public place and as such, people will freely air out their opinions and some will not be lenient about it hence the need to be patient and develop a thick skin to be able those you find unfavorable to you.

comments.author: mvdheuvel1983
comments.body: You are very welcome to the Bitcoin talk community. It is one of the largest internet forums whose aim is learn about all things Bitcoin and cryptocurrency. As a newbie, I strongly encourage you to be patient as you climb through the ranks. It is only impatience that will make you to beginning to write threads to express your frustrations that your topics or comments do not attract merits. Secondly, plan to actively participate in discussions, when you can be sure to answer questions, and look for ways that you can contribute positively to the community. Through participating actively on the forum, you will be able build a solid reputation.

comments.author: nakamura12
comments.body: Welcome to the forum mate. The links that are given above is enough but I would like to give you some tips or pointers. If you plan to create a wallet then you should choose the wallet provider where it is open source which means you can see the code in how it is built or created. You should also pick the wallet that is non-custodial where it's up to you on keeping it safe unlike the custodial wallet where the wallet provider is the one who keep the wallet information (like seed phrase) safe. Well, better start learning about the forum rules to avoid problems if you violate a forum rules unintentionally. Good luck.

There is nothing about the coin that you can not learn from this forum,  just navigate through the forum and pick your areas of interest. This community is made up of people from different parts of the world with different cultures and traditions so you have to expect some form of misconceptions and sometimes arguments about different issues. If you are here to learn then you should be teachable and correctable. You might make mistakes that might warrant correction from the community, some might be polite or rude, but don't take it to heart. You should also avoid the use of Chatbox to make posts and avoid plagiarism. Make sure you reference the source of the information you share in the forum if they are not from you. If you can read the links you have been referred to,  you will have the best of time in this community.
